Package com.craftmend.openaudiomc.api.basic

Interface Actor

public interface Actor
An actor is a further abstraction of a User from within OpenAudioMc. A user is an object representing a platform specific user whose type is given as a parameter to the user class itself. An actor is a more abstract version of this, and is used to represent any user, regardless of platform.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    String
    getName()
    Get the name of the actor (usually the player name)

    Get the unique id of the actor (usually the player uuid)

    Check if the actor has a certain permission node.
    boolean
    isAdministrator()
    If the actor is an administrator (usually a player with OP if we're running on a spigot host, otherwise determined by the platform)
    void
    sendMessage(String message)
    Make the actor execute a command.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      String getName()
      Get the name of the actor (usually the player name)
      Returns:
      the name of the actor

    • getUniqueId

      UUID getUniqueId()
      Get the unique id of the actor (usually the player uuid)
      Returns:
      the unique id of the actor

    • isAdministrator

      boolean isAdministrator()
      If the actor is an administrator (usually a player with OP if we're running on a spigot host, otherwise determined by the platform)
      Returns:
      if the actor is an administrator

    • hasPermission

      boolean hasPermission(String permissionNode)
      Check if the actor has a certain permission node. This uses the underlying platform's permission system if available.
      Parameters:
      permissionNode - the permission node to check for
      Returns:
      if the actor has the permission node

    • sendMessage

      void sendMessage(String message)
      Make the actor execute a command. This is usually a wrapper around the platform's command sender system.
